title: Surly and unsympathetic reception staff
body: We travelled 180 miles with an overnight stay, to get my 96 year old relative to his appointment. Reception staff were focused only on keeping us away from the waiting area, and showed no concern for the wellbeing of the elderly and vulnerable patient we were supporting. I have had better experiences in Eastern Bloc countries pre- 1990. Some urgent training to improve attitudes is indicated, or else some new staff who care! The car park attendant had the right idea, he was busy, but friendly and helpful.

title: Very helpful receptionist
body: This review is relating to three telephone calls to the surgery August 2nd and 3rd 2021.  The receptionist was so helpful and pleasant (my query was a little bit complex).  I really felt that she was listening to what I needed.  I was very impressed.  Thank you so much, KERS.

title: Wonderful Doctors
body: The young lady Doctor I saw today was very knowledgeable , patient and understanding. There are very few in the practice who are able to keep this mannerism in a very busy place so it is commendable. Keep it up.

title: excellent service
body: Woke up with earache. Used My GP to contact surgery. Had an email response within 5 mins offering a telephone consultation which then took place 2 hrs later. Given a face to face consultation at the surgery later that morning. Following this consultation given a prescription for treatment. 4 hrs from initial contact to getting a prescription is excellent service. The My GP contact for an initial triage saves time.

title: Brilliant practice
body: I have only been a patient at Penn hill surgery for a short time but already I have had a great experience. I contacted them to make an appointment for my daughter, the receptionist was very helpful and put my request through as urgent as my daughter had been in hospital the previous week. Within an hour, I had a call from a doctor who made me an appointment that was within 45 minutes of being on the phone to me! Just wanted to say thank you

title: Friendly and helpful receptionists
body: Most of the receptionists are very friendly and helpful and they go above and beyond to help with queries.

title: Inpatient stay
body: Staff were made up to date very quickly about my details on arrival from Peterborough hospital. Good care and compassion with my condition. Food menu simple but as cooked on premises it was nourishing and tasty and hot.  Always popping in to check I was ok and I saw my consultant three times in one day!! Having my hair washed was a blessing in disguise!! Staff adaptation and going that extra mile to make me as comfortable as possible during my stay was exemplary. Hope to return home in a few weeks with recovery well on the way. Thank you all for at this lovely hospital for giving me confidence to manage my debilitation with a smile and a helpful hand!

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very friendly practice
body: I have had both my vaccine jabs at this practice and as someone with a huge fear of needles I came away feeling great.  There are designated seating areas for people who are waiting and people who have had theirs done (all socially distanced).  All staff are wearing the correct PPE and are very friendly (even at this very difficult time).  I explained to the doctor who administered the jab each time that I have a fear and they were both very caring and each time asking if I wanted to lay down to have the injection or if I wanted to lay down after.  I felt very comfortable at this surgery and lets not forget that it is these keyworkers that have worked right the way throught the pandemic putting themselves at risk every day to help the rest of us.   Thanks again to all the staff at the Clapham Family Practice.

author: aquariusef63
title: Picc line
body: I got a new picc line inserted this morning by the team from Belfast City Hospital. Robert and Lesley Ann were first class. They’re both such kind and caring people. They took my old one out with no fuss and the procedure was done so quick, it was the easiest experience I have had getting one in.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible Experience
body: I joined this practice when I moved from London well pre-pandemic. I was unimpressed from my first visit with the reception staff unhelpful, abrupt and expected me to know how the practice works (eg when to call for appts, test results etc). I couldn’t believe the reception team were behind glass meaning you had to shout through the glass to be heard in front of other patients in the waiting room. I’d never seen this in a practice before. Very off putting. Every time I booked an appointment when I fell ill with a condition I had previously I was given an appt with a different GP each time as no-one seemed to be there from one appt to the next - twice in a row were locams as I was told two of the regular GPs were off long term sick. My condition led to mental health issues and I repeatedly had to “battle” through the receptionists to even try and get an appointment to see a Doctor who went straight down the anti-depressant route disappointingly; again no continuity of the same GP despite requesting so everytime having to start from scratch explaining and a nightmare to review medication. It got to the point it was putting me off going. I therefore made the upheaval of moving to City Centre Health Centre and what a difference it made for the better - continuity of one GP all the time, worked with me on mental health therapies to find the right ones not relying on anti-depressants and dud required referrals immediately with regular follow up from the surgery. I wouldn’t recommend this practice to anyone (unconnected to the pandemic causing issues, these issues were there before).

title: Painful
body:
They really have no commitment in their work and they do not care about the lives of their patients at all.
I was wondering how I could make an appointment with a doctor. I go there, they say I will call you, but they do not call me.
They really don't know what the pain is.
I'm going to change this PG.

title: Poor customer service
body:
First time ever attending this hospital.  First receptionist was kind in directing me to the department however if she had checked the computer she was sending me to the wrong department- which was rectified when I returned to her.
So second receptionist just took my name and preceeded to snap at me and tell me I  was late and rolled off some procedure which I was apparently booked in for.  I explained that was incorrect..this continued just back and forth stating I was incorrect. I suggested she checked dob and address, to which she rudely stated go through those doors...again the wrong department to which I then out of frustration went back to the main reception.
My appointment was for an ultrasound and the reptionists in the gynaecology department have not filled me with hope considering this is a rapid access appointment.   I have another appointment tomorrow with the Consultant and I am very anxious, because if this is how receptionists treat patients..well me what is the other staff going to be like.  Just feel really let down, considering it is a sensitive situation.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: LGRT1853
title: Ultrasound
body:
I was a little nervous about getting an ultrasound having just come out of hospital following a severe urine infection and having a kidney stone. I wasn't sure what the additional ultrasound would find.  
Danielle, who explained that she was a trainee, carried out the initial ultrasound examination. She was very friendly and reassuring and explained what she was doing as we went along, which calmed my nerves. On completion, her supervisor, Lynne, then checked the results and she was also very friendly and calming. I found my visit to the Ultrasound department was very pleasant thanks to the staff . I would not be nervous if I needed to go for another Ultrasound. I could not fault anything that day.

title: Gone are the good old days
body: The manner of receptionists and doctors at Chells surgery is appalling. Extremely uncaring. The lack of compassion, understanding and sympathy is non existent. This happens on a regular basis. Will be looking for a new practice

title: Great experience
body:
I recently attended the practice for a little bit of a complicated condition and the Doctor that saw me, went over and above to help and make a plan of care for the next few weeks. I felt that I was assessed holistically, I was listened too and so was my husband. We had a say in the care and investigations in the plan going forward.
As a retired nurse of 30 years, I appreciate and understand the pressure that all areas of the NHS are under. It’s does have to be said, that GP practices are the first port of call for illness and services to encourage and maintain a healthy life style. They are also there to help the sick and vulnerable of which I am one and I have appreciated the recent vaccination program that was run at the practice as it was EXCELLENT. I did write to the practice manager to let them know too. I myself have needed an appointment and understood that a phone call - which is on time, with a caring and careful voice of a practitioner has worked and I prefer it as I don’t like to take up valuable time in the surgery unless really necessary. When attending the practice for an appointment, the centre is clean, tidy and the reception staff are friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to help you. Each practice room is well equipped and there is enough room/for my wheelchair, which really helps. The nursing team (all grades) are so positive, smiling, proactive, and they have helped with any request. My husband I feel confident in their care and we appreciate the holistic assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of the plan of care that we have received for various conditions that we unfortunately have affecting our health. Coming from a nursing and teaching background, we appreciate the realistic challenges you have had and are still/having due to COVID 19 and thank you ALL for everything that you have ad are continuing to do. Thank you for the smiles you have on your faces on difficult days, thank you for the kindness you show on the hard, challenging and emotional days, thank you Health Care Team, we appreciate you and hope that in the coming months the current situation will have become easier for you all and all the services within the NHS. My husband and I will both continue wearing our face masks as we respect that you have to wear yours, and both sides are then providing protection to themselves and others. Thank you once again. Stay safe.

title: Appointments
body: Very difficult to get an appointment-had to wait 12 days for an urgent problem - I am 85 and have mobility problems.

title: Phlebotomy
body: I am extremely needle-phobic, the lovely guy who took my blood was so understanding when I went a bit faint and clammy he made me feel at ease. Thanks for looking after me xx

title: Great service
body: Had tests at Rake Lane and Wansbeck found to be bowl cancer.Fast tracked and operation on 25 May 2021.The staff and team were fantastic I was admitted to the High Depence ward at Cramlington Hospital staff brilliant nothing a bother Surgeon came to see me on Wednesday morning really good service was sent home on the Saturday.Will always be great full to all the NHS.

title: Consideration of elderly
body: Econsult is fine if you are tech savvy and with it but it neglects those unable to use it. Phone calls are hard enough for some but filling in forms online are even harder, especially when not feeling well. I feel sorry for those who have no one to speak up for them.

title: Macmillian nurses proffer patronising frustration
body: Northmapton General Hospital has a deeply serious problem with the communication strategies of their Macmillian cancer nurses. They seek to obviscate and withold information in a most patronising manner which only leaves the patient and family frustrated and cogniscant of their disingenous lack of integrity. Surely they should be caring in end of life situations? NGH has a very low score for looking after the elderly and end of life care and the way the Macmillian nurses act and communicate are a large part of this problem. Please start to communicate with humanity.

title: feed back
body: I found the whole experience efficient, the staff knowlegable willing to answer all questions asked of them and at all times pleasant, skilled at reasuring and making you feel at ease, the hospital/establishment was maintained to a very high standard and spotless the Covid rules were observed at all times, from start to finish a good experience with a satisfactory outcome.

title: Professionally run
body: Covid friendly, on time appointment and quick. I wasn't kept waiting and everything was explained in an easy to understand manner

title: Not at all happy with this practice
body: Since being ill at the beginning of this year , the service from this practice is shocking .. misdiagnosed , my prescriptions being sent to different chemists , my partners name on some of my medicine , unhelpful reception staff , takes ages to get through on the phone , nurse practitioners  very rude , unhelpful and don’t know anything about you or your illness  , so you have to go through your whole story every time … I need regular prescriptions from Fittleworth and there’s always a problem with items that we have to ring the surgery to sort it out !!! So stressful , not at all helpful, sympathetic or caring , would definitely not recommend this doctors surgery .. literally one receptionist and one doctor any good …

title: Absolutely worst practice
body: Worst practice ever, trying to book phone appointment for 4 days, start to ring them at 8 when they open,have to listen about covid for 1.30m then after 15-20 minutes waiting on the phone everything is already booked.

title: Easy to contact
body: I have had to contact this practice on numerous occasions in the past month and have always found it very easy to get through on the phone, with little waiting time. The staff are courteous and helpful. A really nice, easy and friendly experience.

title: Amazing receptionist
body: I want to acknowledge the improvement in the service from the reception team at north field surgery. From ringing to make an appointment to being welcomed to the surgery by a lady who smiled, was polite and efficient and who couldn’t do enough to help. When I said goodbye to the receptionist she used my first name to wish me a lovely day. It sounds like such a small thing but I can’t tell you how much it means to speak to people who are courteous and kind when you are feeling under the weather. This is such an improvement on the way this surgery used to run and so I wanted to take a moment to acknowledge it.

title: Horrendous level of service
body:
Firstly I would like to say the practice staff and clinicians are generally first class but they are let down by management of the supergroup.
I have a condition that requires a nurse appointment every 8 weeks and you would think this would be easy to arrange - certainly not. I have to put in a request 10 days before and enter a lottery, sorry, waiting list for an appointment. This will often result in days when I can’t attend or having to delay the appointment for another week, not ideal. Then comes the usual phone call to say they have to cancel the appointment due to no nurse at the practice. This has become the norm to the extent I now expect a call on the day and no longer believe any appointment time I’m given until I’m actually in the room with them. Luckily I drive as an appointment at your local surgery is rare. Covid is blamed but this problem existed long before covid and sounds more like a lack of resources and forward planning. In fact the only time things worked well was during lockdown when I just had to ring on the day. The online system is hit and miss, I requested an appointment with a GP, 3 weeks laterI queried this to be told a phone appointment has been made & cancelled on the system all without any contact being made. I understand things are difficult right now but I work in an environment where we book clinics 3-6 months ahead and have done throughout the past year so I know it is entirely possible. Is my problem an isolated event? Definitely not if I go by what I hear on a regular basis. PMG get your act together and deliver the care your patients deserve.

title: Poor blood appointments
body: I filled in the online booking system for an appointment but did not get a response. I rang and sat in an approx never ending queue on the phone and made an appointment, I then caught covid so tried to cancel. I tried to cancel the appointment but due to issues with the site and verrrry long queues gave up. I recently tried to arrange another appointment for my cholesterol and health issues,filled in the request and waited and waited and waited(nothing). I had all this week off work so tried to fit in work and tests but aas usual the excuses are covid related. I work for a local authority and have worked all through this covid issue as I have a front line job and did not use covid as an excuse not to be able to do my job. On site. Covid also did not stop looking up details on our system and advising or alleviating tenants worries or concerns. This is a very poor service and seems to be covered by one very busy person. Sort it out.

title: Excellent practice
body: All staff very helpful and polite they all told me what they were doing from beginning to the end of the surgery couldn’t have been in better hands.

title: Receptionists!!
body:
The receptionists are so rude, not polite and getting paid to treat their customers like dirt on the floor. 
The doctors are always so Lovely, but don’t get what the receptionists attitude achieves to them. It’s nice to be kind!!

title: Good outcome
body: Problem with right foot, unable to walk very well, fear of tripping and falling. Exercise program was give, along with good advice. After several day of said exercise everything had returned to normal, my foot is now fully functional again. Many thanks

title: Wonderful staff in A&E minor injuries
body:
I came into minor injuries with what I thought was a damaged ankle. From the beginning, everyone involved treated me brilliantly. My details were taken with a smile by those on the front desk and, from triage onwards, I cannot fault my care. Even when there were waits, someone would come to update me on what was happening. Although this does not allow for specific names, one person, in particular, went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed before leaving, even wheelchairing me to the pharmacy to get my prescription before they closed. 
That said, I also want to give a big thank you to the x-ray team whose thoroughness lead to finding a fracture about which I was unaware, all the nurses, the orthopaedic team, and the two smiling and patient occupational therapists who showed me, as a total novice, how to manage on crutches.  I felt listened to, had everything fully explained, and was encouraged to ask questions all the way through.
One small point that might help – I noticed that there was a typo on the (useful) rolling text in the first waiting room. The nerdy side of me was kept entertained by seeing the word ‘pathyways’ regularly coming up!

title: 'Five star experience
body: A few days ago I took myself into BRI A&E due to breathing difficulties. After a five hour wait during which time I was triaged and sent for x-ray, I was admitted overnight to the ENT ward and sent for CT scan and other procedures. All the staff were friendly and reassuring and the investigations were thorough resulting in a referal to a hospital closer to home for further tests. At all times the doctors took time to explain what they were doing and why and I came away with a very clear understanding of what the issues might be and how they might be resolved with follow-up. Many thanks for your kindness and genuine concern.

title: E-consult
body:
Filled in e-consult (because you can’t get to  speak to anyone) on Tuesday, received an email telling me someone will contact me Wednesday. Still waiting today, Thursday.
Diabolical service.

title: Brilliant practice
body: Very professional and understanding staff and  the Dr's are brilliant listening and supporting patient's.

title: Wonderful staff
body: Recently went to have bloods taken twice. Different nurses each time and both were really pleasant. I hate needles and they respected that and worked around my fears.

title: Couldn’t ask for more
body: Port View have always been a fantastic supportive surgery, but over the last 12m, have gone above and beyond. Having seen 2 GPs for different things, and once for my son, I can only say how efficient, proactive and genuinely concerned for their patients welfare they are. Getting appointments have never been an issue here and even during covid, phone appointments and face to face when necessary have been straight forward to book. The level of care I have received this week has been phenomenal, with the GP taking time to call me and text numerous times in the day to ensure I was ok and even still working at 10pm to check all was well. On both accounts if they hadn’t have acted as quickly as they did, the outcome could have been much different. I should add that it’s not just the Drs who work tirelessly to help us too, the reception team are always friendly and approachable, nothings ever too much trouble. They work so hard and as a whole, it’s clear to see the surgery work well as a team.

title: Excellent
body: My treatment so far has been A 1.All though lm still waiting for my final operation.Unfortunately,A may have been rude to the staff as l was on strong painkillers.I was not aware of this until l return ed home.This l can appologise for,but lm looking forward to seeing you all again.Thankyou to you all during these very testing times.Ps,lm not sure the tablets lhad but won't be taking them again.

title: The best
body: Really can not fault this practice, the online booking is effective and the drs are fantastic for myself and my children

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My Experience on the the East Gynaecological ward
body:
I arrived into hospital on Monday evening. I was instructed by my GP to ring an ambulance to take me, however my wife was happy to drive me up to the accident and emergency department. The department had been made aware that I was coming and I think this had a lot to do with how quickly I was seen to and my needs facilitated. It took about 2 hrs to be seen to by a doctor which is pretty quick given my past experiences in the a&e department.  
The doctor was very nice and I felt that he was very sincere and genuine with what he said. Once I was seen to I was given a bed in one of the bays down in a&e. It isn't terribly comfortable down there. It is very chaotic and not very relaxing and it's hard to get proper privacy hence, I was delighted when the nurses told me there was a bed available on this ward. I was short of breath down in the a&e department but the doctors and nurses tended to my needs and gave me the medication I needed to feel more comfortable.  
I waited for around 24 hrs before I was transferred to the ward. Since I have been up here I feel much more comfortable and at peace. I cannot fault the staff because they are superb. I couldn't say a bad word about them. They are helpful and attentive and answer all my questions to the best of their ability. I couldn't ask for any better care. They really couldn't do enough for you even though they were under extreme pressure managing many other patients. Everything was well explained and I felt that I was informed about everything regarding my treatment. I wasn't left wondering and having to figure things out for myself. They gave me great advice and guidance.  
The ward is spotlessly clean and very comfortable. I have always felt safe and satisfied in my own personal area on the ward. I feel content where I am.  
The food I would say is good the majority of the time. I would say 80% of the food is enjoyable and totally fine. There is relatively good variety so I have always been able to get an alternative option if I don't like something in particular.  
Overall there have been no negatives aspects of my experience in hospital and I cannot think of any big changes I could suggest that would've made my experience any more positive.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Madhound
title: Two A&E departments within 24 hours for the same injury
body:
At lincoln a few things were said but did not happen. Went with a badly cut knee cap caused by hedge cutter. First doctor in grey scrubs looked at cut very uncertain at what to do eventually said going to ask advice from senior colleague.  
On return said got to stop bleeding which was very bad left me alone. Two other staff came after discussion among themselves told me to lie on patients bed wrong way round with leg elevated on head end(thought they was talking about someone else when talking among themselves ) leave leg up there 20-40 mins should stop bleeding. They then left. After a very long time another member came surprised nobody been to see me. Doctor came sometime later, ordered tetanus injections compression dressing then to go home. After sometime staff came dressed wound and sent home.  
Wound still bleeding profusely.  
Had to go Norwich A&E the next evening dressing absolutely soaking with blood stained my outer clothing it was that bad.  
Second doctor most concerned that still bleeding, X-rays ordered and tetanus without me asking. X ray completed doctor came and took ultrasound because small metal fragment found but this found to be old injury.  
Nurse arrived with the first of two tetanus injections. Doctor arrived said what they were going to do as in dressing and that got to keep off leg keep it elevated for 2-3 days to allow injury to start to heal because it is right across knee cap cannot glue or stitch wound because of movement. Also if knee changed in any way ie swelling, heating up, redness etc go straight back to N&N.  
I felt really assured and confident of advice given none of this at Lincoln.  
If only gone to Lincoln could have done real damage to knee no advice given.  
Second tetanus injection served and told can go home now.  
Pleased but saddened that I had to visit two departments (both very lengthy time wise expected but second should have been unnecessary ) within 24hrs with same injury. Pleased that second visit got comprehensive instructions totally lacking first visit.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Ward staff are super
body:
Overall, the only word I can use to describe my experience in Craigavon Hospital is brilliant. I have myeloma so have been in and out of hospital quite a lot and I think Craigavon Hospital is the best hospital there is.  
I came from the mandeville unit to resus and was then transferred to the accident and emergency unit. I waited a number of hrs before I was given a bed in a side room on this ward.  
The staff were excellent. They were pragmatic and tried to get me sorted as quickly as they could. They listened to everything I had to say and responded with great advice and a plan for my treatment. I have anaemia so have been getting blood transfusions and the staff have kept me in the loop with when that will be so I have time to prepare myself. I am in a side room as I am very immunocompromised and for infection control purposes it is thought that I am safer being away from others. This can be quite lonely and isolating but staff are very friendly and they constantly pop in and out as a reminder that they are still there. Even when they are running past thinking of the 100 things they have to do, they always give me a wave or shout a hello. It is reassuring to know that people are genuinely looking out for you as hospital stays can be extremely daunting. When I mention staff I mean everyone working who keeps the show on road. From the cleaners and porters to the kitchen staff and finally the doctors and nurses, they have all individually had an impact on my experience in hospital. They are all extremely professional and I think what they do is a real vocation.  
My ward space is clean and tidy. It is comfortable and I have no complaints. The only good thing about having a side room is that it is very private and you have your own space.  
The food is good and I would have no objections about it. It is what you expect from a hospital which cares for 100s of patients and serves a purpose.  
The wifi works very well for me and staff were able to help me set it up on my IPAD. This is a very useful facility to have in the hospital as it is a good way of entertaining yourself during the very long days.  
I have no negative experiences to report apart from long waiting times which would obviously be brilliant if they could be sped up in an ideal world. I am aware however of the fact it simply takes time to organise things and I am aware that staff try their absolute best to do what they can despite their lack of resources.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Hannah9374
title: Stokemandivile NICU
body:
I felt really strongly that I wanted to leave some feedback from our experience with Stoke Mandivile NICU. I have had two daughters born at 32 weeks and both stayed here in the care of these amazing nurses!  
As soon as my daughters were born we were made to feel so cared for, not just the babies but us as parents too. The nurses took the time to come over and over sit with us to make sure we were ok emotionally and that we understood exactly what we could expect and what was happening with our daughters. Every time we came in the nurse who was caring for our daughter came over to update us and it really felt like a second family and I cannot thank them enough. I actually felt sad that I wouldn’t be seeing these lovely ladies each day when we were discharged.  
The NICU was immaculate and well kept. Especially with having my second daughter during Covid, they made us feel confident that every measure to keep all safe was put in place. The staff went out of their way to make all parents feel welcome from ensuring we were comfortable with getting our daughter out the incubator to the make tags placed on them that made it that little bit more caring.  
The one difference from my first daughter being born in 2018 to now is the online portal to receive updates, photos and videos. Both my husband and I felt this made a big difference to the metal well-being of mothers and reasurment that they were being well cared for. We were always told to call at any point and when we did we were always speaking to a friendly happy welcoming staff member. It was lovely that some staff remembered us from our first daughter.  
I wanted to mention three staff members in particular who we felt really needed acknowledgement for their outstanding care.  
Firstly the lovley Norma, (Hopfully I have spelt that correctly). Norma was so supportive and caring, every time I spoke with her she was full of reassuremeant and you could really tell she loved her job and cared so much for all the babies in her care. I needed support during the emotional journey of expressing milk and I couldn’t have done it without her help. I felt as if I could speak to her about anything.  
Secondly I wanted to mention Ange. Ange really became someone who I really trusted. She cared for both my daughter during their time in the NICU and I felt she really listened to us and did everything possible to help our daughter meet the targets to be discharged. I felt she would really fight for our daughter to ensure they had everything they needed from other staff and doctors.  
Thirdly is Ikrah who is an amazing person. She has such a positive attitude and helped me personally during some very emotional moments towards the end. The way she was with my daughter Ella was fantastic and showed so much love towards her. I would have loved to stay in contact with her after discharge as she bought so much positivity during that time.  
I really hope this feedback is passed on to the staff and they receive the well deserved Recognition for all their hard work. All the ladies were fantastic & turned a very emotional time in our lives into positives which is something we will never forget.

author: stuart69
title: Real sense of care and attendtion
body: During a recent visit to the Respiratory Services at the Western General, Edinburgh my experience left me with a positive feeling - as sense of being cared for.   All staff but particularly the doctor provided excellent service.   The review with the doctor showed insight into my history, took care to listen to me and provided good information and insight into the problems I was having.   Definitely left with a positive feeling of attention being applied, not rushed and a sense of care.

author: Ashleyb91
title: Having my baby girl
body:
In July 2021 I was scheduled for a c-section, this was my second section, but to say I was worried would be an understatement.  
We went to the Borders General Hospital for 7am and were met by two of the most wonderful midwifes you could ask for, Joan & Elidth, from start to finish they were super, they helped ease my worry they chatted away to my partner made him just as big a part of the day as me, was so lovely, when we got to theatre they were still superstars chatting and laughing away  
Then all the theatre staff were amazing, introduced themselves we had a great chat about our kids and dogs really helped ease my worries, they took pictures for us of our little love being born, kept my partner in the know as I lost a lot of blood but they never told me they kept me distracted with my new bundle asking whats her name who she looks more like etc, all while dealing with a big blood loss, very calm it all was my partner knew what was going on but I was none the wiser.  
The after care from Joan & Elidth was 10 out of 10, they really made sure I was feeling good, offered teas coffees toast to both myself and partner, really helpful with showering, No question was too silly for them they were super supportive and great knowledge and what ever elidth didn't know she would find out, even on out realise day it was Joan & Elidth who done it all and said goodbye and really helped put our minds to ease with coming home with a tiny new human, They were just fantastic and the hospital is so lucky to have them.

author: cetusjq57
title: Care and compassion after my broken ankle
body:
I attended University Hospital Wishaw after a fall and breaking my ankle. I was extremely upset and anxious and really was a concern for the nursing staff in casualty. After I was seen and had an X-ray that confirmed my ankle was fractured and dislocated I had a real melt down.  
I would like to thank the Nurse Practitioner Jane for the reassurance and the care and compassion of the manager Andy, who came back to make sure I was comfortable and arranging a bed for me.  
You are what the NHS are all about. Well done and thank you from the bottom of my heart.

author: Booker
title: Unsuspected stomach ulcer
body:
Towards the end of July at about 3am I woke up to use the toilet which is normal for me. I felt a little light headed as soon as I was up but then I started to stagger and bounce off the walls in the hallway and then collapsed on the floor.  
I crawled to the bathroom but was unable to stand and was also sweating profusely all over my body. I managed to stand and thought I have to get to the lounge quickly to lie down on the sofa but I was still on the verge of vomiting and collapsing but got there slowly but it felt like an age.  
I couldn’t shout for help but had to use my iPad to call my wife upstairs. She came down and supported me and try and figure out what was going on...stroke, heart attack? It felt like something serious was going to happen. I managed to get to sleep and felt better when I awoke but still dizzy and lightheaded when I awoke.  
I went to use the toilet and compared to last night I got there ok but when I opened my bowels I noticed that my stool was black and I knew I had to get this checked so I called 111 and was advised to go to A&E.  
It was a long wait but I got to see a Doctor and explained what had happened but couldn’t figure what was wrong but was happy that I felt normal again and was going to send me home when I remembered to mention about the “black stool” I passed and he did an internal exam straight away and told me that I was bleeding internally and admitted me for tests.  
I had bloods and observations taken and also an endoscopy which found an ulcer that was bleeding. This was fixed and I felt great after the treatment as the pain I had put up with for 3-4 years had gone and I just need to take some medication for a while to protect the stomach lining.  
Whilst I was in the hospital which looked very clean due to the constant hard work of the domestic staff and carers, the treatment I received from the nurses who were spread thin from start to finish was amazing and it really made me proud of the NHS and Team St Mary’s Isle of Wight.  
I am a senior in a care home on the island and what you do and how you care for people is important to me and what I saw and heard personally and from other patients experiences was good compared to Southampton and QA.  
It could have gone very bad for myself if undiagnosed and also for the importance of mentioning all the little details for the Doctor to make a correct diagnosis which can potentially save someone’s life.  
A massive thank you from me to you all at St Mary’s Isle of Wight especially AAU and SSU.

author: JammyDodger82
title: I can hear again
body:
I have been struggling with my ears for over a week, been to my GP, started on treatment and a week down the line - still bad.  
I attended the ENT ward at Victoria Hospital today, I was greeted by the Senior Charge Nurse who was very friendly and helpful. I was then seen by Shirley. She explained everything and was so reassuring. She assessed my ears and worked her magic!  
I can now hear again, I am so thankful for her kindness and support. A true professional. What a great service, I am very grateful.  
5 star service!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: vegawt79
title: My story is about the respiratory team
body: I have Bronchiectasis I am usually on antibiotics several times in the year due to this condition. The help and support I've received from Dr drain and Doreen has been incredible, especially given the extreme pressures of Covid. I just want to thank them for their advice, support and interventions. I want them to know how much I appreciate them because my condition would be much worse without them. They do an amazing job would be lost without them.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lucy3
title: Womens outpatients Grantham hospital
body: The staff I met during my appointment were professional & caring taking time to explain my health issues, risks and potential further treatment. They effecrively explained the brief procedure and provided reassurance during it. The service was punctual and facilities clean. Could not have had a better experience. Thank you

author: Marys daughter
title: The fantastic care and support they gave my Mum
body: Just a few lines to thank all on Ward Firth 4 Northern for the fantastic care and support they gave my Mum on her recent stay in hospital. At 84 years old she had never been in hospital before, and had a very traumatic admission. She was terrified when she came in, but when she soon settled down thanks to the care of the lovely staff. She was sad to leave in the end, but shes home now after a period of rehabilitation and doing well

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: nashiracb34
title: Care given on Ingram Suite Lincoln
body: Julie at Ingram Suite Lincoln was so kind, profession help yesterday and went out of her way not only to me but everyone. Julie spoke quietly and gave such good advice from start to finish. A truly lovely lady and good at her job. Thank you.

author: yellowec47
title: Service provided by NHS and District nurse's
body:
In April I had a severe foot infection. The underside of my foot and my little toe had to be removed due to this infection.
The treatment and service I received from the NHS staff was of the highest standard. The after care I received from the district nurses was also outstanding. I would like to thank everyone for their excellent support and exemplary care.

author: caelumxx39
title: Thank you for all the care given to my Mother
body:
My Mother fell and Fractured her Hip Bone.  
The Ambulance Staff were amazing. Assessing her then transferring her to Belfast RVH A& E.  
Doctor Chris in A&E was very attentive ,especially informing me via phone what was happening as I could not get in to see her,  
She was Transferred to Ward 4C FRACTURES.where she had to wait a few days for Surgery.A very busy Ward ..  
a lovely Domestic called Sharon was very attentive to all the women in the Ward,  
Eventually she was transferred to Meadowlands for Rehabilitation.  
Everyone has been brilliant. Nurses, care assistants ,  
Domestic and catering staff. Physiotherapists and Occupational Therapists , Surgeons,,,everyone

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: perseuscz83
title: Being refered to podiatrist at John Mitchel place Newry
body:
From first time i meet the staff in Newry i was made at ease by the way the staff explanied what was happing. The staff made me feel at ease and step by step told me  
what they where going to do to fix problem with my feet.  
They did the work in a very profesional way..  
The way they did the follow up service by way of making appointments to suit time and  
day for me was 1st rate. as well as giving me advice to look after my feet .  
All the staff from reception to podiatrist was excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Nana50
title: The very skilled team could not have made my experience better
body:
Yesterday I had my appointment for Hysteroscopy at Ayr hospital. I'd waited months instead of weeks for an appointment & was a bit apprehensive about what the findings would be after such a wait to be seen.  
The staff at Ayr are incredibly skilled at explaining the procedure and putting my mind at rest, Everything was explained thoroughly & my mind settled with the knowledge I'd leave knowing everything I needed to know & options depending on outcome of what comes next.  
I felt Michelle and her very skilled team could not have made my experience any better as they had considerable experience to assist with anything I needed or wanted. This is not a procedure you'd normally want but their considered approach made it clear to me that I was being put first & for that I can't thank them enough.

author: beidmq46
title: 10/10 service and care
body: I was admitted at the beginning of August 2021 for Day Surgery at Queen Margaret Hospital. I was very nervous about my procedure but as soon as I met the staff I felt at ease, from the anaesthetic team, theatre nurses, my consultant, Dr Devi, ward clarkess, and nursing staff. Everyone was fantastic. I ended up having to stay over night which I was not expecting and was more unwell than I thought I would be. Special mention to Sam, Hayley and Ally who looked after me so well and put me at ease. Real life angels. Thank you so much to Nola and the amazing team at QMH, 10/10 service and care.

author: Charlotte1705
title: A+E visit
body:
I went to A+E and saw a Doctor called Mike. He was very professional and caring with his duty. His service was excellent and anyone in his future care will be well looked after. He helped my problem with a cyst on my back by referring me to the surgical team and it was no problem at all. He made me feel at ease and well listened too. Nothing was too much trouble.  
Thankyou very much.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Takencare
title: A wonderful person who goes above and beyond
body:
I was sent to A&E by my GP.  
The staff did a wonderful job of ensuring that they spoke to me, took all relevant tests and ensured I was ok.  
Shout out to Rory who is a wonderful person and goes above and beyond to ensure patients are well looked after and even did a number of tests personally with me as the nurses were so busy.  
He really made me feel well cared for and in the right hands.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: correspondencewz97
title: PV bleed
body:
Four weeks ago I had a termination because I just wasn't ready I felt guilty and bad for doing what I did. That went all well until 4 weeks later I was bleeding very heavily as losing tissue as well on the sun and it got worse.  
I rang 111 and they advised me to come into hospital as soon as possible as soon as I got in my car to come to hospital I was bleeding so bad it went through my trousers my underwear and a towel sat on, I waited for 2 hours in a& e to be seen. I asked the lady who is doing my bloods to see where I can get a pad or get changed or something to feel more comfortable as I could not sit in that any more.  
The doctor called me then asked me questions, I was talking to him them he walked off and did not come back at all, I did not even know what was happening. I got to the ward at 23. 30 that night I was uncomfortable I feel like I needed a shower, I stayed in that night. The doctor wanted me to have a scan the next day but no one turned up to that me. I was so upset and annoyed I just wanted to go home and then I have to come bk the next day to have my scan done.  
So had my scan done and the doctor said the next best thing is surgery to remove the remaining tissue. Which was booked for Thursday. So I had to not eat or drink anything the night before and had to be there by 8 in the morning I waited all day to have my surgery done and the doctor who put the canular in my arm is was so painful and my hand was so cold, he did it twice in the same arm in two different places.  
So it was my turn to have it do after waiting for ages, got down there and they I was turned away because for a emergency so that made me feel worse and so upset and just cried then because I wanted it over and to be done with after waiting all day as it was. They finally told me at in 11 last night that I will have to wait until the next day to have it done so I had to stay in again and after that I had it done at 11 40 in the morning after I had it done I was home that day because I was just had enough

author: lacertajk46
title: Excellent maternity care in Oban
body:
Thank you to all the staff at the maternity unit in Oban. I had wonderful care throughout both my pregnancies, and great continuity of care with the same midwife both times. My named midwife Rosie was brilliant, spent time listening to all my worries, was easy to contact, had great communication skills and always a smile and a friendly face!  
I also had brilliant care and support in my first pregnancy by the team, especially when I had complications in labour.  
Thank you to Elayne, Rosie and the whole team in Oban maternity, from the cleaner, secretary, ultrasonographers and all the midwives I met who were always friendly and welcoming and supported us through our journey to start our wee family.

author: mineralxf97
title: An overall good experience
body:
Following a referral from my GP, I came to the Emergency Department at Daisy Hill Hospital. I found A&E to be quite good despite the long wait. The staff themselves were very good.  
Up on the female surgical ward I have had an overall good experience - the doctors and nurses are all incredibly nice, caring and helpful. I have had no problems so far with my stay and my care and experience has met my expectations - after all it is a hospital and you cannot expect much more than the good care I have received.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lockdownmum18
title: Postnatal care and support
body:
Having your first baby during a pandemic where you can't meet family and friends is hard but then also having minimal to no support which the government and NHS advise you should have is even worse.  
I had my daughter in November 2020 and received Health visits until she was 6 weeks old. The health visitor was covering for the one we should have had. We then had a scheduled phone call with her due to pandemic rules which was cancelled when she to also went off sick and this was not rearranged. I had a list of questions we needed answered and after chasing HV's in our area and phoning several numbers we were meant to see someone in the surgery when getting one set of her jags. The message was not passed on so a brief discussion was had in the corridor in passing instead. With questions still unanswered and more of me making phone calls I finally reached a health visitor but again phone call felt rushed and like the health visitor was not interested as she had too much to do. I was promised I would be given appointment soon.  
Following this my partner and I continued to work through things on our own, questions going unanswered. Appointments would be made for the future and then cancelled last minute by health visitors time and time again. Covid was used as an excuse but it seemed clear the staffing shortages was the problem as when on the phone staff were rude and unhappy about having to cover my area due to staff absences/shortages.  
We finally got a 7 month visit by a bank staff member who helped with questions I had at that moment in time, and after speaking to her about how I have felt about the service/lack of she advised I make a complaint. I have held off on doing so to until now hoping it would improve but after still not having been contacted by anyone again when you should receive an 8 month visit and having a list of unanswered questions which I don't want to waste GP time on I finally want to raise these issues. I no longer feel comfortable phoning the various numbers I was given as it's a gamble as to who will answer and whether they will be willing to help.  
Speaking to other mums of babies similar age both in Forth Valley and other Scottish regions they are receiving all appointments and have regular contact and support with their Health Visitors.  
In the past I believe there was walk in clinics which maybe this area (Banknock/Bonnybridge) should be considering if their lack of staff and time is meaning families are being let down around care and support.

author: mineralbd44
title: The Maternity ward is very calm
body:
My time in the Maternity ward at Daisy Hill Hospital has been quite good. The ward itself is very nice. All the midwives are extremely friendly, caring and very accommodating. With regards to my C-section - I have to say that it was really well organised. All the staff - doctors, nurses and midwives knew exactly what they were doing and all I can say about everyone involved in my care was that you were fantastic. My stay could really not have been improved any.  
One point I would like to make note of is the calmness of the ward at Daisy Hill. Previously I have given birth at the maternity in another hospital, and compared the two Daisy Hill is a much calmer environment.  
Many thanks again to all the midwives for looking after me so very well!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: requirementqy58
title: Good time in maternity but very warm
body:
My time in Maternity at Daisy Hill Hospital has been very good. The midwives are all brilliant and very helpful. The ward itself is very clean and tidy - overall very good. Everything is very east to find.  
My only problem was that I was very warm on the ward and could have done with a fan.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: whisperqm55
title: A quiet and settled ward
body:
My admission to Daisy Hill's Maternity Ward was a bit of a shock. However, everyone has been very helpful. The midwives are great - absolutely fantastic - I have no complaints.  
The ward itself is pretty settled, which I am thankful for (other than the usual ward noise which I know cannot be helped).

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sunxc86
title: Cannot praise staff enough
body:
I arrived to Daisy Hill Hospital via ambulance after experiencing severe stomach pains. The ambulance crew were dead on - very very good.  
Going into A&E it was alright - it was very very busy. The staff however were absolutely brilliant - I really couldn't praise them enough.  
Up on the female surgical ward I have also had a very good experience. The nurses are all very very good. Although they are all good, I would like to especially mention nurse Angela who has been an absolute gem. Throughout my stay she has been exceptionally good to me and ensured that my care has been exemplary  
My only minor problem would be that the television is kept on too late on the ward and that all the flashing lights make it difficult to sleep at night. If these two points were fixed my hospital stay would be perfect.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Ali11
title: Cardic hub and heart failure clinic ulster hospital
body: Just want to say a massive thank you to all the staff in the cardic hub and heart failure clinic in the ulster hospital. You guys are absolutely amazing thank you for everything from the first day I step foot in till the cardic centre everyone was friendly and caring can thank you guys enough. Keep up the good work 🌈🌈

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: starfd44
title: Attentive staff
body: It was very good and are very attentive, pleasant to be cared for on all the ward I have been in.

author: trappereq34
title: Excellent Care
body: Excellent home care, very kind and helpful team. Very grateful for the service.

author: TPWK
title: I went to hospital
body:
The patients were very helpful and were very supportive. A lot of the staff were very nice and supportive but some were more helpful than others. Whenever I was upset I would very often have staff offer me support but sometimes there wasn’t as much support but I do think it depended on who the member of staff was.  
I think the ward was a very friendly environment but was cold quite often but I do know that they tried to sort it out. The activities were very good but I do think we could have had more, they were fun though. My room was ok it was quite basic room which had essentials like a bathroom, bed, wardrobe, desk etc. It got very cold very easily though I do wish we had access to thicker blankets. I think some of the meals were ok but some were not nice. I do wish that we had some better meals because were quite unpleasant.

author: cubenn85
title: Cannot praise the staff enough
body: I recently was an inpatient in the stroke ward in crosshouse hospital Kilmarnock. I was lucky. My condition was trivial when compared with some others, over a five day period I observed and was privi to the care and dedication of all the staff in this unit. I cannot praise these people enough, they are constantly delivering above + beyond. They could never be paid enough + never will be.

author: izarxs54
title: Everyone has been kind, caring and professional
body:
My experience, in hospital, has been a very positive one, so far. Having had a stroke and awaiting further procedures.  
Everyone has been so kind, caring and professional - from medical staff, auxiliary support, other support services, domestics, porters etc.  
The level of care has been wonderful and I have felt valued and supported. The staff, in general, all deserve great praise for their dedication and support well done.  
crosshouse (ward 3e+3f especially)

author: hydrusbh54
title: Extremely helpful and caring
body: Extremely helpful and caring.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: caelumqd65
title: staff are superb
body:
My experience in South Tyrone Hospital is amazing on the ms infusion ward.  
Staff are superb.  
Building is central.  
Wards are spacious.  
All facilities are nearby.  
Easy parking - eases pressure on Craigavon.  
one - one. exceptional case.  
Airy and very welcoming.  
Less pressure on overworked staff.  
NEVER SHOULD HAVE CLOSED.  
Very comfortable.  
rehome office staff - open up wards.  
Craigavon hospital cant cope with pressure in A&E. Nurses are angels.  
4-6 floors lying empty. Could be used for lots of things.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: beth m
title: Staff on Ward F5 and F2
body: My dad was admitted to ward F2 and later to F5 at wythenshawe hospital, I wasn't able to visit him but from the things he said to me about his stay I thought I should write something here as the staff were apparently just the best and really did take the best care of him, nurse Merlin and Olivia you were absolutley brilliant and the people that help out sorry I'm not sure what your roles are called Ian Steve Kiera he said you guys did litterally everything you could for him and ill be forever greatful, so thankyou. All nhs staff seem to be just fantastic and I and all my family will always be greatful for everything you do

author: wullie16
title: Prostate cancer
body:
Diagnosed in nov 2016 with prostate cancer, open surgery to remove it march 2017 could not be removed, had radio therapy April and May that year it worked. Jan 2018 cancer was back, was told doctor would have to discuss treatment that day that didnt happen 2 weeks later asked back to beatson was given prescription by nurse, told to get it from chemist go to my surgery make appointment with nurse start treatment, so I contacted prostate cancer uk they tell me I should have had discussion with doctor at beatson and had scan to see what stage my cancer was at first that didnt happen.  
I eventually got appointment with doctor told him I was not happy about what had happened the doctor said no point in having scan now as it would not show anything as my treatment would have now shrunk the tumors now dont no what stage i am at, now being treated with depression dew to my treatment, was told last year dont worry if treatment stops working we have other treatment for you, didn't want to no it might stop working that has made me feel worse.  
I collect my own treatment from chemist arrange for nurse every 12 wks at my health centre and blood tests, beatson phones you every six month speaks to you for six minutes & I feel they are only interested in psa results that's it.

author: capellazk84
title: Breastfeeding Facilities
body:
I had to take my 14 month old to the minor injuries unit at Antrim Area Hospital following an accident.  
After about an hour I asked a nurse if there was anywhere I could go to breastfeed my baby as we were sitting in a very busy corridor and he was very distracted and unsettled as result and due to his injury. This nurse directed me to a toilet as an appropriate place to feed my child.  
I was shocked and angered that in 2021 in a hospital of all places that this would be her response. It’s simply not good enough, there should be a designated area that should always be available and all staff are aware of. Having a child in A&E is stressful enough without having to argue with staff about finding somewhere appropriate.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Ticketyboobigtam
title: I had a knee replacement in June 2021
body: From entering the hospital on the Friday to Wednesday, I had the best attention from the nursing staff in ward 11. The food was very good and although my wound leaked and I had to remain in hospital for a few extra days, I was kept informed and well cared for.

author: mercuryyj75
title: Lesion removal at dermatology, seen quickly
body: Excellent treatment at Stirling Dermatology Dept.   Went to get a lump on face checked out and they said it would be a good idea to get it removed.   Was about to make an appointment when the plastic surgery nurse (David) said he could fit me it immediately if I wanted as the expected patient hadn't turned up.   David and Angela were excellent and put me at my ease.   They were chatty and funny and carried out the procedure in a professional and caring way.

author: hotelkj78
title: The nurses were patient and friendly
body:
Really professional, welcoming, on time and helpful.  
Dr Nandy is fantastic, and all of the nurses (Amanda + Sasha) + HSW were really patient + friendly and I will definitely be back!  
Thank you so much.

author: sierraxy78
title: staff were friendly
body:
Kayleigh + Dr Nandy  
Friendly, professional and make me feel at ease

author: Nunny
title: Lesion removal
body:
My appointment to remove a small lesion on my left forearm. Day case.  
Dr.Hood, nurses Sara and Lynne end of July 21.  
Everything went well. From the reception to the surgical room I was treated well and safely before, during and after the procedure. The advice was clear and the whole experience was good and I left feeling assured that I had been in good and well trained hands by the staff in Dermatology unit Treliske.

author: hippoed64
title: staff made me feel comfortable
body:
Sacha, laura and Kayleigh  
Lovely ladies made me feel comfortable. Helped with my problems. would refer to friends if needed.

author: giftzn86
title: All ladies are very friendly
body:
Amanda, Laura and Kayleigh  
Very informative, great bedisde manner,. All ladies very friendly and put me at ease.  
Many thanks

author: uniformky49
title: Big fear when eating some food
body: I had panick attacks and lots of physical symptoms. I got big fear to eat some food, because I felt like having allergy. Had the symptoms like swollen neck, dizziness, short of breath which makes me believe that I have allergy reaction. For some time my food list was very little basically chicken and rice. Felt every day tired no energy, got big fear to eat anything because I believe I will die after allergy reaction. I don't believe that is anxiety, well but I try to speak with specialist. After few sessions I felt much better more believing myself it takes me maybe 10 sessions to the best results. I still need to work with my self but now I feeling much better and is big thanks to all team who help me this hard time.

author: nanook78
title: Equipment forgotten to be removed
body:
Stayed a night in dgri after a planned operation on ward B3, staff were great, but the ward was very under-staffed. I normally take medication at night, this was not administered as requested. I was supposed to be getting my catheter and morphine pump removed first thing in the morning, which nursing staff forgot about and I felt they became agitated with me for not getting out of bed (how can I move about my room if I'm hooked up to two different types of equipment).  
Twice I heard the staff complaining about the fact I hadn't got out of bed, because my room was needed for another patient. Again, how can I get myself organized, if no one has been in to remove the equipment I'm hooked up to?

author: crocodilefr95
title: felt very comfortable
body: Both staff Kayleigh + Dr Nandy were very nice, I felt very comfortable :)

author: attendantfn64
title: Really kind and friendly
body: Really kind and friendly, informative and willing to answer questions. Super helpful staff thank you

author: tucanafr65
title: friendly and re-assuring staff
body:
Friendly and re-assuring staff Dr Nanday, Kayleigh and Laura  
Very informative  
Blood nurse was fantastic, painless and quick  
Thankyou

author: outflowxj47
title: They treated me perfectly
body:
Staff members Tracy + Amanda they treated me perfectly with respect to my body.  
Today it was my first time to put a coil on me.  
My experience is brilliant.  
They give a lot of information. Thank you so much. I appreciate.

author: Robot71
title: not able to contact and make a doctors appointment
body: I moved to Girvan on my own just before lockdown. I have Aspergers so I have found life extremely difficult and confusing. I only go out to take my dog for a walk and I now have a friend who travels here to get some shopping to me as shops especially Asda is too frightening.   My neighbours are really nice but I put a pretend face on when I can go out and look as if I am fine but I  am really scared and depressed. I am also menopausal which has really affected my body and mind badly. What makes things more difficult for me is that I look really well and healthy. I've become an expert at pretending that I'm fine!   I wrote this, not to complain because I think Girvan is a great place to stay but to bring to the attention of the doctors that I am unable to make contact via email. I can not use zoom etc and I have a major phone phobia and am unable to find any email address. When I registered I was asked for my email address. I really need help and don't know how to ask for it kindly, without drama or offending anybody. Thank you for listening.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: saturnrz47
title: Urosepsis/nephrostomy
body:
I have had both good and bad experiences with urology/nephrology. In November 2019, I had to come in via ambulance with serious kidney infection. All staff I encountered were fantastic. The following morning I developed sepsis. I don't remember massive amounts of information, but the doctors and nurses on A9 were fantastic and I spent a few days in Critial Care. Special mention to nurse Elaine, wonderful lady, who looked after me and kept me sane and calm!  
A year on, the same thing happened. Got brought up by ambulance, treated like I was a time waster. I kept begging for help to go to the toilet and even my bell was ignored. Yes there is/was the Covid crisis, I waited hours to have any pain relief. Was finally put on A9. Due to the same issue flaring up again, was told nephrostomy was the only option. I really out up resistance to this, as I detested it last time and still do! Was told I would have exploratory surgery, to see if scar tissue could be removed to insert stent instead. So I begrudgingly agreed to nephrostomy, on the understanding that I might be able to ditch the nephrostomy in January.  
When January came, got called to the clinic, my surgeries have all been out on hold for 12 to 18 months. I have now also waited for right kidney removal for over two years. And apart from tube changes, I have had no appointments, apart from to untighten a tube that had been screwed in too tightly from tube change, I have heard nothing! ! I have had nothing but constant infections and pain since having the nephrostomy, I've lost my job, I have had to self refer to Healthy Minds, from the impact on my mental health, I feel like I have been forgotten about.  
I know unless I get kidney failure of sepsis again, that it is unlikely I will be remembered, seen or treated. Fair enough patients with cancer and more serious issues need to take presidence, but apart from 3 monthly tube changes, nothing is done.  
When you are lucky enough to see anyone from urology/nephrology, they are really good, over worked and wonderful staff. The staff who look after you in RI for tube changes are also very good. But for the record, the tube changes do hurt, no gas and air doesn't cut it, I do find every tube change traumatic and yes I do want sedation please!  
I know I'm not the only one waiting. I know other departments across the board are struggling too. But we are people not just hospital numbers and statistics. How do I feel? I hope I've made this clear. Will writing this make an iota of difference? Probably not.

author: avocetrq69
title: Nurses were helpful and friendly
body:
Amanda, Laura and Kayleigh  
The nurses were very helpful and friendly :)  
Made me feel at ease at my appointment

author: slideff89
title: Made me feel safe and happy
body:
Amanda, Laura and Kayleigh  
All lovely ladies that made me feel safe and happy. Keep up the good work.

author: Lauraw
title: Brilliantly run Ward 1
body:
Admitted for biopsy of kidney. Was very apprehensive despite having a nursing background. Staff were so attentive, caring and out my anxiety at ease very easily. They were very busy but still spent the time to explain and speak to me. Too many names to mention.huge thank you Colin , Elaine ( charge nurse), Libby,nicola, ellie , Margaret (csw) and of course the student nurses. I can’t remember their names but Dionne was the one looking after me pre op ,and her bedside manner and nursing skills exemplary. Brilliant run ward, extremely clean and possibly the nicest staff around.well  
Done everyone x

author: Grateful mum and dad
title: Very poorly little boy with breathing difficulties
body:
My 2 year old little boy attended paediatric A&E he was struggling to breathe and very short of breath. The nurse on duty Kayleigh was so attentive and caring whilst looking after him , she went above and beyond and stayed with us after she should of been away home. This nurse is definitely in the right job looking after poorly children and worried parents.  
Then while over in Blossom the excellent care continued with wonderful nurses a special thanks to Shauneen, Hannah ,Grainne, Ciara, and Nichola and all the doctors. Truly grateful xxx

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anniebo87
title: Treatment and care of my mother
body: My mother has the district nurses from Holywood arches East Belfast attending her. She was very ill but has come on slowly but surely at home. The nurses are excellent at their job and go above and beyond for my mother. They come twice a day for her insulin and driver. We as a family are eternally grateful for the job they do and care they give my mother and also to our extended family.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tom S
title: Employment Journey
body: I feel the support is excellent, very helpful employment specialist Younis,   from the  futures positive service.

author: HospitalUser16
title: Admitted to Trauma Ward 3A
body:
I was admitted to Ward 3A on 10th July 2021 after a non fault car accident. Raigmore was under Code Black and it was a mini heatwave so not the best time to be bedridden in a hospital! Despite this and clearly stretched staffing my care was excellent. From the auxiliary who showed me such kindness when I was crying over missing my son to the Staff Nurse in charge of the Ward who was sympathetic and patient when I was terrified of the injections despite having a million other things to do! The physio who gently encouraged me to get out of bed and all the other unsung heroes of the Ward. I cant thank them enough.  
It was absolutely hectic. I've never seen such busy individuals. Literally non stop from patient to patient.  
My only complaint. The awful food. As a coeliac it was beyond disgraceful. The poor folk doing the food orders on the tablet had to go through a so called allergy free menu every day that was chock full of allergies! There was next to no gluten free options and I did struggle to find food to eat. With covid I had no visitors and no way to get access to healthy safe options. This was my only complaint and nothing to do with the staff on the Ward. Purely a catering issue.  
So huge thanks to all in the Ward. You are absolute heroes.
